descript.abstract: The Component Diagnostic Features table lists the typical soil features, such as ochric epipedon or cambic horizon, for the referenced map unit component.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.1.1.3143

attr.attrdef: The distance from the top of the soil to the upper boundary of the identified diagnostic horizon or to the upper limit of the occurrence of the diagnostic feature.
The distance from the top of the soil to the base of the identified diagnostic horizon or to the lower limit of the occurrence of the diagnostic feature.
The distance from the top of the soil to the upper boundary of the identified diagnostic horizon or to the upper limit of the occurrence of the diagnostic feature.
Kind of diagnostic horizon or diagnostic feature in the soil.
A non-connotative string of characters used to uniquely identify a record in the Component Diagnostic Features table.
The distance from the upper to lower boundary of the identified diagnostic horizon or feature.
The unique identifier of a record in the Component table. Use this column to join the Component Diagnostic Features table to the Component table.
The distance from the upper to lower boundary of the identified diagnostic horizon or feature.
The distance from the top of the soil to the base of the identified diagnostic horizon or to the lower limit of the occurrence of the diagnostic feature.
The distance from the top of the soil to the base of the identified diagnostic horizon or to the lower limit of the occurrence of the diagnostic feature.
The distance from the top of the soil to the upper boundary of the identified diagnostic horizon or to the upper limit of the occurrence of the diagnostic feature.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The distance from the upper to lower boundary of the identified diagnostic horizon or feature.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
